The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?

Comments_List: I developed skills in speaking, writing and reading spanish language.
I furthered my knowledge of Spanish, including grammar and concepts about the Latin American world, through the curriculum and resources this course provided.
Reading Spanish literature, more rapid tense choices (i.e. picking tenses without thinking about it)

I have definitely improved my spanish speaking abilities as well as my listening and reading skills. I read some interesting literature in spanish for this class that has also informed me of spanish history and culture.
My fluency and ability to read texts improved through this class.
I significantly improved my Spanish.
Good knowledge of everything latin american.
It is very well organized but sometimes not the most engaging and requires a lot of work.
The course is fine.

A strength was the series of assessments. They were varied and allowed many criteria to be evaluated. For example, if one struggled with written exams, there were ample opportunities for speaking evaluations. A weakness was the homework towards the end of the semester. I would spend 2-3 hours each night on it. I often became frustrated and would lower my quality of work because I was tired of the amount of time I spent on it.

The class is well organized and the expectations are very clear. Class every day can get a bit monotonous, but the course definitely facilitates improving on one's spanish abilities. The workload, however, was disproportionately distributed so the last few weeks were extremely heavy with work whereas the rest of the semester was manageable.

There seemed to be a lot of work towards the end of the class, when some nights in the beginning only had 10 minutes of homework. The homework could be better spaced so the last few weeks wouldnt be as stressful.

I think there could be more reading. I like the historical discussion as well. There is too much focus on grammar and not enough on speaking in class. Instead of exercises at home, reading and reading comprehension would be better. Also there were no take home essays in this class which I did not like. I wish it were more like a literature class and felt less like a grammar course which is totally possible.
The class had good student engagement and discussions.
the supersite isnt great for learning
Yes, I think I improved a lot in speaking and writing spanish but it was a lot of work.
Yes, the course was much more enjoyable than L3.

If you want to get better at spanish, definitely. Class every day gets boring and sometimes a drag, but I feel confident in my abilities in spanish now and I have learned some very valuable things about history, culture, society, etc. that expand to more than just learning the language.
Yes, especially if you really want to improve your Spanish.
Avoid this class if possible in exchange for more advanced L5 courses with literature.
Yes, I would recommend.
Yes
